abstract: China said it had evidence showing that employees of the mining giant had engaged in commercial espionage for at least six years.
snippet: China said it had evidence showing that employees of the mining giant had engaged in commercial espionage for at least six years.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  China said Sunday that it had evidence showing that for at least six years, employees working for the British-Australian mining giant Rio Tinto engaged in commercial espionage, costing the country about $100 billion.

headline.main: China Says $100 Billion Was Bilked by Rio Tinto
headline.print_headline: China Says $100 Billion Was Bilked By Company
